reviews.name: A constellation with...
reviews.text: I'm giving this manga a one out of five, not because it's a bad manga, but because it's an amazing manga with a dogshit ending. The first 130 chapters are amazing, but the end villains are so boring and the story gets so confusing, while the characters You care about are just left to gather dust. Solo leveling will always be important to me as what got me in to manhwas, but will also always leave a bitter taste in my mouth at such an amazing concept wasted on a horrible ending

comments.name: A constellation without a name
comments.text:
a little more elaborate review i drafted up
i have incredibly complex feelings about solo leveling. It‚Äôs what got me into manhwa, and is the godfather of most video game style mangas. It immediately grabs your attention with amazing art and ominous villains, making you root for the main character and excited to see what happens next. Necromancy is the perfect power for a manhwa, and it really makes you intrigued to see what the next shadow soldier will be. But behind all this flashy action lurks a sad truth. At the beginning of the book, you are intrigued and confused, and the MC knows just as little as you, as it takes you on a journey to grow stronger, introducing eye catching characters and egging you on with creepy villains.

comments.name: A constellation without a name
comments.text: As the story goes on however, these characters are barely explored, or just completely ignored, as you forget about the story and it distracts you with awesome fights and the MCs growing army. But then, after about chapter 130, everything grinds to a halt. You say ‚Äúsure, this is cool, but why? What‚Äôs the big picture?‚Äù And as the story is brought to the center stage, you see just how empty and lifeless it is. The beginning villain who has powered the whole story thus far is thrown away instantly, all to set up a new group of villains. At the same time, the story becomes uselessly complicated as time travel and reality manipulation come into the picture, and it leaves you feeling confused and overwhelmed. But i could forgive all of that, if the final villain of this whole story wasn‚Äôt a complete pile of horse sh**. He has no motivations, no ominous presence, and no build up. It‚Äôs just the most formulaic throwaway villain of all time, as gaping plot holes rest in the background. The final fight is a nonsensical brain rot clusterfuck where they just repeatedly smash their heads together with no choreography or action whatsoever. It ¬†is the most anti climactic, disappointing ending of all time, as the main character turns back time to before everything happened, and the story ends. Except it doesn't. For some reason, they decided to include 20 more chapters of filler, useless stuff i could barely force myself to read. Solo leveling is the cornerstone of manhwa, and will always be important as a staple in the manga community which every manga reader should read, but it is also the most disappointing manga of all time.

reviews.name: Spydaop
reviews.text:
This is for anybody who wants to read this story.

I need you to think of the best story you have ever read, the best fights, the best characters, the best art, and throw that all away.

Because this story right here, is the best thing I have ever read, I may have finished it in just 2 weeks because of how good it is. It is a rollercoaster, you will laugh, cry, and get angry, but it's all worth it in the end. Do not, not read it. You¬†NEED¬†to read it. I promise you, it is amazing, and if you don't like it, I think therapy is a choice for you.¬†

This story exceeds infinite (however possible)¬†

Spoiler!
Jinwoo Sung's journey = Weak, Sacrifice, Strength, Endless, Strong, Powerful, Exceed, Indure, Monarch, Husband, Dad, King.

reviews.name: nutella QnQ
reviews.text:
just finished reading this rollercoaster journey and i'm having a goosebumps bcs of how perfect the ending is for us readers the author,and the staffs, the company itself. this is one of the masterpiece you won't be bored of re-reading it . i'm glad i could be a part of the one that chose to give this series a read after a numerous times my friend recommended it to me,by during that time it was still incomplete, but now that the anime is on air,and the series has officially ended, i'm holding back my tears . this is perfection in itself even more than the big series that usually for the route of incomplete ending or hanging storyline,this brought a change to the shounen genre ! this is how it was supposed to be to complete a series beautifully . i can't praise it enough thank you for creating this series jeong so rak nim and big thanks to the company,the staffs,editors,the authors,the illustrators,tha scanlation teams,the translation teams,the uploaders and my friend that recommend this series and lastly all of you that read this series . thanks for making this a hit series .

sincerely, nutella . (crying rn for someone as strong,loyal and lovely as beru TT)

comments.text:
don't compare this to overgeared dude. overgeared is good but the next day, it all happen in a game while this doesn't happen in a vr/game. next is that overgeared has to many plot armour that i have to drop it 4x while this has only about 3 or 4 plot armour before he became super op. overgeared would be amazing if it didn't happen in a vr cause that would have a better story and overgeared is quite boring because they never showed his "Real Life" outside the game until a few hundreds chs in the novel. so don't compare this to something like a vr because vr is just a game were the mc has a lot of plot armour because it won't kill him irl.

so my rating for this would be:

Solo Leveling: 3.8/5 and the art carried it with the action and what i liked about it is that it wasn't harem ending

Overgeared: 2.9/5 because it all happened inside a game, took forever for the author to show his real life, too many plot armour and it won't fuc**** end until this one has atleast 1000+chs in manhwa with the changes of being cancelled and axed
*chances

reviews.name: Quei
reviews.text:
The MC build, both it's psych and powers are one he** of a good trip to read trough.

The building of the secondary characters is also very good and fun to accompany trough the journey.

The Art Design is just superb, even on the fighting scenes, is something not "FOOSSSH BA BOM" it's well written and painted to give a good sense of what is happening and how.

The power progression of this manhwa is very solid, when i say that is because it's not something that can be easily shot trough the roof at some given point for some "shounen MC moment".¬†

This is a 5/5 for me.

Althought i'm sad of how

Spoiler!
the ending turned out to be a little anti-climatic,

from the main arc. And that¬†

Spoiler!
the "multiverse" episodes were good material to read,

it still left the mouth with "i want more of this".

reviews.name: flicker
reviews.text: I‚Äôm at a loss for words. Not really, since, I have a lot to say, but I am. The entire story was amazing. I don‚Äôt usually read stories like this, since I usually read romance manwhas, but I‚Äôm so glad I picked this up. Every battle strikes my nerves as if I were the one experiencing it. Sung jin-woo will definitely stay in my mind as the shadow monarch. I only didn‚Äôt really favor the ending, but it fit the story since he deserved a happy one. I was just a bit upset that nobody remembered anything at all. It was saddening. I loved the entire plot line, it wasn‚Äôt too rushed or too slow, battle scenes were amazing to watch, there was even good relationships and a good amount of deaths without plot armor. I‚Äôd definitely re-read this in the future, and any other works the author creates. "Arise" WILL ALWAYYSSS BE SOME HEATTT

It's a fairly generic, but well executed journey behind a character that becomes OP, but his enemies challenge him. They're capable, intelligent, willing to go through many lengths and they're all good bits if the journey.

The story is kept focused, no romance, minimal time for side plots or other characters. Just enough for key developments.¬†

Now the side story? I'll never read it, the author died shortly after completing the main story and the follow up should have never existed.

reviews.name: Ivern
reviews.text:
This is Solo Leveling. Here, that's the review. That's literally it. Read it, you [REDACTED].

OKAY FINE. I'll do it properly. You don't even pay me for this, y'know. People usually pay me to write bull[REDACTED]. Anyway, The King of action mangas. The legendary piece of work that sparked hundreds of copycats. Genre defining, a pioneer in the art of showing spiky-haired people absolutely mauling eachother, the one and only, Solo Leveling.¬†

The art is top notch, the action is great. It is streamlined to the extreme. It's like a Formula One racing car: it does what it's on the label, and it does it da** efficiently. Of course, it sacrifices some aspects. Its charactization is a bit... A bit. But it does have some irony! And most of the characters are quite entertaining, both due to their design and personalities! It even has an ant best boi in it, ffs! What more do you want? You know when I say that comedies can get away with a lighter, more two-dimensional characterization? The same goes for action. It is that good.

MC's power set is of course the big star here. Interesting, powerful, in costant evolution, grown in time and carefully. Kill your enemies, and then make buddies of them. Forced buddies. The Power of Friendship, at its finest. It¬†is a purebred, fast paced action flick sustained on the absolute [REDACTED] baddassery of the shadows.

I'll admit, the whole lore behind it all and the last arc were a bit chaotic and superficially handled, but honestly, it is a complete work. With a conclusion. And a great god**** journey to get there. Sure, there are mangas with better fight choreographies, and definitely there are some with more thoughtful encounter tactics out there, but this one is their daddy. You do not disrespect The Daddyeh.

As I said, it is Solo Leveling. Read it, you [REDACTED].

comments.text: @Zuccini Yaga So basically the rank goes from E (the lowest) to S (the highest). The dungeon doesn't necessarily make Jin-Woo go to S on the go, it's like climbing the stairs kind of thing. For now, he is around C-B or possibly A strength. The systems allow him to become stronger by completing mission, so even when he's not entering the dungeons he's still getting stronger. And yes, no one knows that he already high ranked until he reevaluated himself officially in the future chapters. Hope this helps.

comments.name: NeverWhere
comments.text:
As i like Solo leveling as my favs ever i have to afmit that every time i come to this last arc i see all it's limit and this one is, for me, the worst chapter of all 200, confusion is the main point of everything.

We had this rush and drop in the quality of the sotry cause the illustrator was really ill and everything had to be cut extremely short, then he died shortly after.

It pain me so much every time thnking of what he could have accomplished if he was still alive and well and of how much better and satisfying would have been the ending part of Solo Leveling (that it was probably planned to end at chapter 200 without the side stories).

Still, i have to honor the will of an artist that even at the end of his days and suffering a lto was able to stell itself to give us the end of this great adventure.

And i want to plead once more to a chance in the korean manhwa industry that drain the artists life so much that most of them become ill making their life horrible.
A weekly release is a must but a better way to do it, with more people working on it and reducing the burden for everyone, is something that must be done.

comments.text: So basically this is a battle angels vs devils, earth is the playground, nobody cares about humans and those nation level hunters, MC's dad included, whose power "comes from the light on the other side" are just puppets of the angels, while the devils are busy dicking each other over instead of uniting. plus there was the system and this "architect" or "creator" and a prophecy and it all starts looking like another author who doesn't have the ability to filter ideas and tries to somehow stick every single idea together with duct tape...

comments.text: @Tyrus This is a coherent story, it just takes time to develop

comments.name: Zuccini Yaga
comments.text:
@Tyrus Thanks for the summary, but I don't agree with the duct tape thing.
The Architect was an angel bc he had wings, but "for some reason" he came up with a way to combat his kind and also mess with the laws governing MC (through "his system"). ü§®¬† I don't think the "why" has been revealed yet, but it's interesting so far?

comments.name: Bisami Blanch
comments.text:
@Kyoshiiii

I understand that, that's why I said what I said. She's seen him fight and been able to handle monsters, she's heard about his feats in the news and seen that he has gotten better. It's simply no longer as excusable at this point since he's come so far. Why deprive others of help due to your own lack of faith? ¬†At the end of the day she will always receive protection. The same can't be said for others that have no relation to him. Look what happened with the Ant Arc, he received criticism for not going soon enough, many died and if he had been there earlier less would have. The criticism he received was fair, and can be applied to future large scale scenarios. As his sibling, that incident would have made me reflect on my siblings new responsibilities.¬†

¬†Cause it doesn't even matter if he doesn't go, if someone can't defeat it, the threat will eventually come to their area and the responsibility will still fall on him to defeat it.¬†

comments.text: how the fu** am I able to move on from this chapter... I don't know, it seems like a wise yet foolish decision... To have the ability to go back through time, & 10 years is a lengthy process, everything he had worked for will only be his to keep. I know that he doesn't really crave for recognition but he poured everything he had in his disposal to save the world... He will be a hero no one knows about, whose name will never prevail, his name will be nothing but a mere, graceful whisk of memory whispered within the minds who bears the familiarity of his prowess... I don't really know what to feel about this... Truly...
